com.idevicesinc.sweetblue

Class BleManagerConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.idevicesinc.sweetblue.BleNodeConfig
      • com.idevicesinc.sweetblue.BleDeviceConfig
        • com.idevicesinc.sweetblue.BleManagerConfig
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable

    public class BleManagerConfig
extends BleDeviceConfig
    Provides a number of options to pass to the BleManager.get(Context, BleManagerConfig) singleton getter or BleManager.setConfig(BleManagerConfig). Use Interval.DISABLED or null to disable any time-based options.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  BleManagerConfig.DefaultScanFilter
      Convenience implementation of BleManagerConfig.ScanFilter which filters using a whitelist of known primary advertising UUIDs passed in to the constructor.
      static class  BleManagerConfig.DeviceNameComparator
      Default sorter class for sorting the list of devices in BleManager.
      static class  BleManagerConfig.P_AndroidDeviceLayerFactory 
      static class  BleManagerConfig.P_AndroidGattLayerFactory 
      static interface  BleManagerConfig.ScanFilter
      An optional whitelisting mechanism for scanning.

      boolean allowManagerStatePolling
      Deprecated. 
      - Use defaultStatePollRate instead. If you want it disabled, set that option to Interval.DISABLED.
      boolean autoPauseResumeDetection
      Default is true - Controls whether BleManager.onResume() and BleManager.onPause() will get called automatically by using Application.ActivityLifecycleCallbacks.

      Default is Interval.DISABLED - Length of time in seconds that the library will automatically scan for devices.

      Default is Interval.DISABLED.

      Default is false - set this to allow or disallow autoscanning while any BleDevice is BleDeviceState.PERFORMING_OTA.

      Default is 3.0 seconds - Length of time in seconds between automatic scan pulses defined by autoScanActiveTime.

      Default is Interval.DISABLED - Same as autoScanPauseInterval except this value is used while the app is paused.

      Default is 0.0202 seconds - The rate at which the library's internal update loop ticks.

      Default is BleManagerConfig.DeviceNameComparator.
      BleManagerConfig.ScanFilter defaultScanFilter
      Default is null, meaning no filtering - all discovered devices will be piped through your BleManager.DiscoveryListener instance and added to the internal list of BleManager.
      Interval defaultStatePollRate
      Default is DEFAULT_MANAGER_STATE_POLL_RATE seconds - The rate at which the library will poll the native manager's state.
      Interval delayBetweenTasks
      Default is Interval.DISABLED - This sets an amount of time to delay between executing each task in the queue.
      boolean enableCrashResolver
      Default is false - this option may help mitigate crashes with "Unfortunately, Bluetooth Share has stopped" error messages.
      boolean enableCrashResolverForReset
      Default is true - this option gates whether the "crash resolver" described in enableCrashResolver is invoked during a BleManager.reset() operation to forcefully clear the memory that causes the crash.
      boolean forcePreLollipopScan
      Deprecated. 
      Use scanApi with BleScanApi.PRE_LOLLIPOP instead.
      Interval idealMinScanTime
      Default is BleDeviceConfig.DEFAULT_MINIMUM_SCAN_TIME seconds - Minimum amount of time in seconds that the library strives to give to a scanning operation.
      Interval idleUpdateRate
      Default is 0.5 seconds - The rate at which the library's internal update loop ticks, after minTimeToIdle has elapsed.
      Interval infinitePauseInterval
      Default is DEFAULT_SCAN_INFINITE_PAUSE_TIME - This is the amount of time SweetBlue will wait before resuming a scan.
      Interval infiniteScanInterval
      Default is DEFAULT_SCAN_INFINITE_INTERVAL_TIME - When running an infinite scan, SweetBlue will pause the scan, and restart it again a short time later, defined by infinitePauseInterval.
      SweetLogger logger
      Default is DefaultLogger - which prints the log statements to Android's logcat.
      boolean loggingEnabled
      Default is false - basically only useful for developers working on the library itself.
      boolean manageCpuWakeLock
      Default is true - requires the Manifest.permission.WAKE_LOCK permission in your app's manifest file.
      boolean manageLastUhOhOnDisk
      Default is true - This allows SweetBlue to store the last Uh Oh time to disk.
      Interval minTimeToIdle
      Default is 20.0 seconds - This is the amount of time the library will wait with no tasks before lowering the update loop tick to idleUpdateRate.
      boolean postCallbacksToMainThread
      Default is true - whether all callbacks are posted to the main thread or from SweetBlue's internal thread.
      boolean revertToClassicDiscoveryIfNeeded
      Default is true - SweetBlue uses BluetoothAdapter.startLeScan(BluetoothAdapter.LeScanCallback) by default but for unknown reasons this can fail sometimes.
      boolean runOnMainThread
      Default is true - SweetBlue originally ran most operations on its own internal thread based on some theories that since proved invalid.
      BleScanApi scanApi
      Default is BleScanApi.AUTO - see BleScanApi for more details.
      Interval scanClassicBoostLength
      Default is Interval.DISABLED - This will run a short classic scan before a regular BLE scan.
      BleScanMode scanMode
      Deprecated. 
      This is deprecated in favor of BleScanApi. If this is not null, SweetBlue will set scanApi automatically from this setting.
      BleScanPower scanPower
      NOTE: This is ONLY applicable on devices running Lollipop or above.
      Interval scanReportDelay
      Default is 0.5 seconds - Only applicable for Lollipop and up (i.e.
      boolean stopScanOnPause
      Default is true - makes it so BleManager.stopScan() is called automatically after BleManager.onPause().
      Interval uhOhCallbackThrottle
      Default is 30.0 seconds - BleManager.UhOhListener.UhOh callbacks from BleManager.UhOhListener can be a little spammy at times so this is an option to throttle them back on a per-BleManager.UhOhListener.UhOh basis.
      PI_UpdateLoop.Callback updateLoopCallback
      Default is null - provide an instance here that will be called at the end of BleManager.update(double, long).
      java.util.List<UuidNameMap> uuidNameMaps
      Default is null - optional, only used if loggingEnabled is true.

        Constant Field Values

      • loggingEnabled

        public boolean loggingEnabled
        Default is false - basically only useful for developers working on the library itself. May also be useful for providing context when reporting bugs.

      • logger

        public SweetLogger logger
        Default is DefaultLogger - which prints the log statements to Android's logcat. If you want to pipe the log statements elsewhere, create a class which implements SweetLogger, and set this field with an instance of it. If loggingEnabled is not set, then this option will not affect anything.

      • enableCrashResolver

        public boolean enableCrashResolver
        Default is false - this option may help mitigate crashes with "Unfortunately, Bluetooth Share has stopped" error messages. See https://github.com/RadiusNetworks/bluetooth-crash-resolver or http://developer.radiusnetworks.com/2014/04/02/a-solution-for-android-bluetooth-crashes.html or Google "Bluetooth Crash Resolver" for more information.

        NOTE:" This option gates a "proactive" approach towards mitigating the above-described crash.
        See Also:
        enableCrashResolverForReset

      • enableCrashResolverForReset

        public boolean enableCrashResolverForReset
        Default is true - this option gates whether the "crash resolver" described in enableCrashResolver is invoked during a BleManager.reset() operation to forcefully clear the memory that causes the crash.
        See Also:
        enableCrashResolver

      • stopScanOnPause

        public boolean stopScanOnPause
        Default is true - makes it so BleManager.stopScan() is called automatically after BleManager.onPause(). If you're doing an infinite scan (e.g. by calling BleManager.startScan(), i.e. no timeout), then the scan will automatically continue after BleManager.onResume() is called.
        See Also:
        BleManager.onPause()

      • scanClassicBoostLength

        public Interval scanClassicBoostLength
        Default is Interval.DISABLED - This will run a short classic scan before a regular BLE scan. Sometimes, for whatever reason, the native BLE stack will refuse to see a particular device. However, if you go into Bluetooth settings on the phone, it sees it (they do a classic scan here), and suddenly it shows up in a BLE scan after that. So the idea with this feature is to do the same thing without having to go into Bluetooth settings. This seems to affect the number of devices that are returned in total, and how quickly they are discovered, so this is disabled by default now. If you decide that you need to use it, we recommend going with a time length of DEFAULT_CLASSIC_SCAN_BOOST_TIME.

      • infiniteScanInterval

        public Interval infiniteScanInterval
        Default is DEFAULT_SCAN_INFINITE_INTERVAL_TIME - When running an infinite scan, SweetBlue will pause the scan, and restart it again a short time later, defined by infinitePauseInterval. The android stack tends to find less and less devices the longer a scan runs. This helps to keep scan results coming in when performing an infinite scan, leading to better results.

      • infinitePauseInterval

        public Interval infinitePauseInterval
        Default is DEFAULT_SCAN_INFINITE_PAUSE_TIME - This is the amount of time SweetBlue will wait before resuming a scan. See infiniteScanInterval

      • autoScanDuringOta

        public boolean autoScanDuringOta
        Default is false - set this to allow or disallow autoscanning while any BleDevice is BleDeviceState.PERFORMING_OTA. If false, then OTAs may complete faster if you're periodically scanning through autoScanActiveTime or BleManager.startPeriodicScan(Interval, Interval). BleManager.startScan() will still start a scan regardless.

      • revertToClassicDiscoveryIfNeeded

        public boolean revertToClassicDiscoveryIfNeeded
        Default is true - SweetBlue uses BluetoothAdapter.startLeScan(BluetoothAdapter.LeScanCallback) by default but for unknown reasons this can fail sometimes. In this case SweetBlue can revert to using classic bluetooth discovery through BluetoothAdapter.startDiscovery(). Be aware that classic discovery may not discover some or any advertising BLE devices, nor will it provide a BleManagerConfig.ScanFilter.ScanEvent.scanRecord() or BleManagerConfig.ScanFilter.ScanEvent.advertisedServices() to BleManagerConfig.ScanFilter.onEvent(BleManagerConfig.ScanFilter.ScanEvent). Most likely you will be forced to filter on name only for your implementation of BleManagerConfig.ScanFilter.onEvent(BleManagerConfig.ScanFilter.ScanEvent). As such this is meant as a better-than-nothing back-up solution for BLE scanning.

      • runOnMainThread

        public boolean runOnMainThread
        Default is true - SweetBlue originally ran most operations on its own internal thread based on some theories that since proved invalid. While the library can do so, it's now recommended to run on the main thread in order to avoid any possible multithreading issues. Note that if this is set to false, then allowCallsFromAllThreads will automatically be set to true. Setting this to false will result in a smoother UI experience, at the cost of the possibility of multithreading issues, as stated above. While we have put a lot of effort to safe-guard against multithreading issues, they may still happen, which is why this is true by default.

      • postCallbacksToMainThread

        public boolean postCallbacksToMainThread
        Default is true - whether all callbacks are posted to the main thread or from SweetBlue's internal thread. If runOnMainThread==true then this setting is meaningless because SweetBlue's internal thread is already the main thread to begin with.

      • manageCpuWakeLock

        public boolean manageCpuWakeLock
        Default is true - requires the Manifest.permission.WAKE_LOCK permission in your app's manifest file. It should look like this: <uses-permission android:name="android.permission.WAKE_LOCK" /> Sets whether the library will attempt to obtain a wake lock in certain situations. For now the only situation is when there are no remote bluetooth devices BleDeviceState.CONNECTED but one or more devices are BleDeviceState.RECONNECTING_LONG_TERM. The wake lock will be released when devices are reconnected (e.g. from coming back into range) or when reconnection is stopped either through BleDevice.disconnect() or returning BleNodeConfig.ReconnectFilter.Please.stopRetrying() from BleNodeConfig.ReconnectFilter.onEvent(BleNodeConfig.ReconnectFilter.ReconnectEvent). Wake locks will also be released if Bluetooth is turned off either from the App or OS settings. Note that Android itself uses some kind of implicit wake lock when you are connected to one or more devices and requires no explicit wake lock nor any extra permissions to do so.

      • forcePreLollipopScan

        @Deprecated
public boolean forcePreLollipopScan
        Deprecated. Use scanApi with BleScanApi.PRE_LOLLIPOP instead.
        Default is false - Only applicable for Lollipop and up (i.e. > 5.0), this will force the use of the deprecated "pre-lollipop" scanning API, that is BluetoothAdapter.startLeScan(BluetoothAdapter.LeScanCallback). There is no known reason you would want this, but including it just in case.

      • autoPauseResumeDetection

        public boolean autoPauseResumeDetection
        Default is true - Controls whether BleManager.onResume() and BleManager.onPause() will get called automatically by using Application.ActivityLifecycleCallbacks.

      • uhOhCallbackThrottle

        public Interval uhOhCallbackThrottle
        Default is 30.0 seconds - BleManager.UhOhListener.UhOh callbacks from BleManager.UhOhListener can be a little spammy at times so this is an option to throttle them back on a per-BleManager.UhOhListener.UhOh basis. Set this to Interval.DISABLED to receive all every BleManager.UhOhListener.UhOh and manage them yourself.
        See Also:
        BleManager.UhOhListener

      • manageLastUhOhOnDisk

        public boolean manageLastUhOhOnDisk
        Default is true - This allows SweetBlue to store the last Uh Oh time to disk. This makes it so that even if you shutdown, and restart BleManager, SweetBlue will still respect the uhOhCallbackThrottle. Otherwise, if you restart the manager, and get an BleManager.UhOhListener.UhOh it will be dispatched immediately.

      • autoScanDelayAfterResume

        public Interval autoScanDelayAfterResume
        Default is 0.5 seconds - Unless Interval.DISABLED, this option will kick off a scan for autoScanActiveTime seconds autoScanDelayAfterResume seconds after BleManager.onResume() is called.

      • autoScanDelayAfterBleTurnsOn

        public Interval autoScanDelayAfterBleTurnsOn
        Default is Interval.DISABLED. If set, this will automatically start scanning after the specified Interval. This also depends on autoScanActiveTime, in that if that value is not set, this value will do nothing.

      • autoScanActiveTime

        public Interval autoScanActiveTime
        Default is Interval.DISABLED - Length of time in seconds that the library will automatically scan for devices. Used in conjunction with autoScanPauseInterval, autoScanPauseTimeWhileAppIsBackgrounded, autoScanDelayAfterResume, and autoScanDelayAfterBleTurnsOn, this option allows the library to periodically send off scan "pulses" that last autoScanActiveTime seconds. Use BleManager.startPeriodicScan(Interval, Interval) to adjust this behavior while the library is running. If either autoScanActiveTime or autoScanPauseInterval is Interval.DISABLED then auto scanning is disabled. It can also be turned off with BleManager.stopPeriodicScan().
        See Also:
        autoScanPauseInterval, BleManager.startPeriodicScan(Interval, Interval), BleManager.stopPeriodicScan()

      • autoScanPauseInterval

        public Interval autoScanPauseInterval
        Default is 3.0 seconds - Length of time in seconds between automatic scan pulses defined by autoScanActiveTime.
        See Also:
        autoScanActiveTime

      • autoScanPauseTimeWhileAppIsBackgrounded

        public Interval autoScanPauseTimeWhileAppIsBackgrounded
        Default is Interval.DISABLED - Same as autoScanPauseInterval except this value is used while the app is paused.
        See Also:
        autoScanPauseInterval, BleManager.onPause()

      • idealMinScanTime

        public Interval idealMinScanTime
        Default is BleDeviceConfig.DEFAULT_MINIMUM_SCAN_TIME seconds - Minimum amount of time in seconds that the library strives to give to a scanning operation.

      • autoUpdateRate

        public Interval autoUpdateRate
        Default is 0.0202 seconds - The rate at which the library's internal update loop ticks. Generally shouldn't need to be changed. You can set this to Interval.DISABLED and call BleManager.update(double, long) yourself if you want to tie the library in to an existing update loop used in your application.

      • defaultStatePollRate

        public Interval defaultStatePollRate
        Default is DEFAULT_MANAGER_STATE_POLL_RATE seconds - The rate at which the library will poll the native manager's state. This only applies to devices running Marshmallow or higher. This call can drain the battery if it's left at the same rate as autoUpdateRate, as it uses reflection to poll the native state. This is needed on some phones where SweetBlue doesn't receive a state change when it should. If this is null, then state polling will be disabled.

      • idleUpdateRate

        public Interval idleUpdateRate
        Default is 0.5 seconds - The rate at which the library's internal update loop ticks, after minTimeToIdle has elapsed.

      • minTimeToIdle

        public Interval minTimeToIdle
        Default is 20.0 seconds - This is the amount of time the library will wait with no tasks before lowering the update loop tick to idleUpdateRate.

      • delayBetweenTasks

        public Interval delayBetweenTasks
        Default is Interval.DISABLED - This sets an amount of time to delay between executing each task in the queue. The delay simply makes sure that the amount of time requested here has passed since the last task ended.

      • scanReportDelay

        public Interval scanReportDelay
        Default is 0.5 seconds - Only applicable for Lollipop and up (i.e. > 5.0), this is the value given to ScanSettings.Builder.setReportDelay(long) so that scan results are "batched" ¯\_(ツ)_/¯. It's not clear from source code, API documentation, or internet search what effects this has, when you would want to use it, etc. The reason we use the default value provided is largely subjective. It seemed to help discover a peripheral faster on the Nexus 7 that was only advertising on channels 37 and 38 - i.e. not on channel 39 too.

        It has been observed that with the default value on the Pixel, it can take over 5 seconds to get the first batch of devices seen. Due to this, the default will most likely go to zero for v3.

        NOTE: This option is only relevant if BluetoothAdapter.isOffloadedScanBatchingSupported() returns true - otherwise it has no effect because the hardware does not support it.

      • defaultScanFilter

        public BleManagerConfig.ScanFilter defaultScanFilter
        Default is null, meaning no filtering - all discovered devices will be piped through your BleManager.DiscoveryListener instance and added to the internal list of BleManager.
        See Also:
        BleManagerConfig.ScanFilter

      • defaultDiscoveryListener

        public BleManager.DiscoveryListener defaultDiscoveryListener
        Default is null - can also be set post-construction with BleManager.setListener_Discovery(DiscoveryListener), which will override the implementation provided here.
        See Also:
        BleManager.DiscoveryListener

      • allowManagerStatePolling

        @Deprecated
public boolean allowManagerStatePolling
        Deprecated. - Use defaultStatePollRate instead. If you want it disabled, set that option to Interval.DISABLED.
        Default is true - SweetBlue polls the native Bluetooth state to ensure it's always up-to-date with the current Bluetooth state (in case we don't receive a callback from the native Bluetooth stack for any reason). However, there are rare cases where the state we get from polling isn't wrong per se, but ahead of the native callback. So for instance, BLE was turned off, then on...polling may say it's ON, then try to connect to a device. Then we get the native callback, but by this time, the connect has failed. In this case, you should turn this to false. But then you are at the mercy of Android's Bluetooth callbacks coming in. This polling is only done on devices running Android Marshmallow (6.0+) or above.

      • scanMode

        @Deprecated
public BleScanMode scanMode
        Deprecated. This is deprecated in favor of BleScanApi. If this is not null, SweetBlue will set scanApi automatically from this setting.
        Default is null

      • scanApi

        public BleScanApi scanApi
        Default is BleScanApi.AUTO - see BleScanApi for more details.

      • scanPower

        public BleScanPower scanPower
        NOTE: This is ONLY applicable on devices running Lollipop or above. Default is BleScanPower.AUTO - see BleScanPower for more details.

      • updateLoopCallback

        public PI_UpdateLoop.Callback updateLoopCallback
        Default is null - provide an instance here that will be called at the end of BleManager.update(double, long). This might be useful for extension/wrapper libraries or apps that want to tie into the BleManager instance's existing update loop.

      • uuidNameMaps

        public java.util.List<UuidNameMap> uuidNameMaps
        Default is null - optional, only used if loggingEnabled is true. Provides a look-up table so logs can show the name associated with a UUID along with its numeric string.

      • defaultListComparator

        public java.util.Comparator<BleDevice> defaultListComparator
        Default is BleManagerConfig.DeviceNameComparator. This specifies how to sort the list of devices in BleManager.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BleManagerConfig

        public BleManagerConfig()
        Creates a BleManagerConfig with all default options set. See each member of this class for what the default options are set to.

      • BleManagerConfig

        public BleManagerConfig(org.json.JSONObject jo)
        Creates a BleManagerConfig with all default options set. Then, any configuration options specified in the given JSONObject will be applied over the defaults. See BleNodeConfig.writeJSON() regarding the creation of the JSONObject

        Parameters:
        loggingEnabled_in - Sets loggingEnabled.

    • Method Detail

      • newWithLogging

        public static BleManagerConfig newWithLogging()
        Returns a new constructor that populates uuidNameMaps with Uuids using ReflectionUuidNameMap to help with readable logging.

      • clone
